page.title: 03NORMAN PARK
page.content: Norman Park is very large and has many sports pitches for games like football, cricket, hockey and korfball. It has six changing pavilions. The children's playground is quite exciting and has slides, seesaws, swings, a roundabout and even a helicopter and tank. There is a floodlit athletics stadium and two large carparks. We found out that the name of the park came from Montague Norman who owned the nearby estate. He must have been very important because he was the head of the Bank of England and signed all the pound notes. They have many events in Norman Park such as circuses, fairs, motor shows, sports tournaments, horse trials and dog shows. It's a very busy place. The River Ravensbourne runs through a tunnel across the park.
